body:
Ok. So that worked, but now I'm getting this error in the runDaylightAnalysis component: Runtime error (MissingMemberException): 'list' object has no attribute 'X'
Traceback:
line 105, in getsurfaceStr, "<string>"
line 183, in RADNonPlanarChildSurface, "<string>"
line 1041, in main, "<string>"
line 1509, in script It's particular to the curved surfaces, I think, as a cube works just fine. I dug around in the script a little, and it looks like at one point the "coordinates" parameter of getsurfaceStr is passed a list of four points by RADNonPlanarChildSurface rather than one. Those four points are at the corners of one of the curved windows. I stopped digging because I'm not really sure how everything works in there.
